commit_message:
Ceph: tidy scripts

This PS tidies the Ceph scripts. In addition, it allows the
chart to be removed and re-deployed without data loss,
and improves robustness to rebooting nodes and/or
the cluster.

Change-Id: If5a65d0dcca1d049b177d9bffb654a13d56c3823

subject: object-server can 409 in response to x-if-delete-at
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 22:16:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'object-server can 409 in response to x-if-delete-at

Previously, if the expirer had a stale work item (because the object
was overwritten or deleted, or some other process handled the delete),
then it would keep retrying for reclaim_age, but every time it'd get
back a 412.

Now, have the object-server be smart enough to say, "I have more recent
information than you" and let the expirer accept that as success.

Change-Id: I0a94482ed16cb30ce79074e053e6177fe97bcaa9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-18 18:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_expirer.py', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/expirer.py'], 'message': 'object-server can 409 in response to x-if-delete-at

Previously, if the expirer had a stale work item (because the object
was overwritten or deleted, or some other process handled the delete),
then it would keep retrying for reclaim_age, but every time it'd get
back a 412.

Now, have the object-server be smart enough to say, "I have more recent
information than you" and let the expirer accept that as success.

Change-Id: I0a94482ed16cb30ce79074e053e6177fe97bcaa9
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
object-server can 409 in response to x-if-delete-at

Previously, if the expirer had a stale work item (because the object
was overwritten or deleted, or some other process handled the delete),
then it would keep retrying for reclaim_age, but every time it'd get
back a 412.

Now, have the object-server be smart enough to say, "I have more recent
information than you" and let the expirer accept that as success.

Change-Id: I0a94482ed16cb30ce79074e053e6177fe97bcaa9

subject: functional tests: Register SQLAlchemy models
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 13:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "functional tests: Register SQLAlchemy models

As the order of executed test is random, it may happen test using
database is executed first. In such case database schema is created
without ovn_revision_numbers table because SQLAlchemy model is loaded
later. It causes an attempt to remove the table during cleanup because
it's registered by the time of the cleanup.

This patch loads all the models beforehand so no race can happen. It
also fixes a case when you want to run just a single test using
database.

Change-Id: Ic6d449f4f652abd48ae1b285e0ef965c4a6329e1
Closes-bug: #1744320
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
functional tests: Register SQLAlchemy models

As the order of executed test is random, it may happen test using
database is executed first. In such case database schema is created
without ovn_revision_numbers table because SQLAlchemy model is loaded
later. It causes an attempt to remove the table during cleanup because
it's registered by the time of the cleanup.

This patch loads all the models beforehand so no race can happen. It
also fixes a case when you want to run just a single test using
database.

Change-Id: Ic6d449f4f652abd48ae1b285e0ef965c4a6329e1
Closes-bug: #1744320

commit_message:
ESFIX:Workaround for UnicodeEncodeError

When there are chinese words in trove API request, the webob will
throw UnicodeEncodeError in debug log. We comment out these lines
to work around this bug.
At the same time, I noticed that the other components do not print
the contents of the req in the log, which should be why they did
not encounter a similar problem.

Closes-Bug: #1720121
Change-Id: Ic12575855110e5d21d02d9cd586400edc3618f49

subject: drop is_ovn_service_enabled in devstack
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 02:45:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix devstack is_ovn_service_enabled

In devstack/lib/networking-ovn, function is_ovn_service_enabled is used
to check where a service such as ovn-controller is enabled.

It should have similar behavior than function is_service_enabled in
devstack, since they have the same usage, like:

    if THE_ENABLED_CHECK_FUNCTION SOME_SERVICE ; then
        TRY_TO_CONFIG_IT
    fi

But currently, is_ovn_service_enabled doesn't work as expected, since it
will always return 0 if ovn is enabled and no matter what kind of sub-
service it is.

This patch is try to fix that.

Closes-Bug: #1743487
Change-Id: Ic1213d0c93aea3f73f8c092b3ffb69ff23382735

commit_message:
drop is_ovn_service_enabled in devstack

In devstack/lib/networking-ovn, function is_ovn_service_enabled is used
to check whether a service such as ovn-controller is enabled.

It should have similar behavior than function is_service_enabled in
devstack, since they have the same usage, like:

    if THE_ENABLED_CHECK_FUNCTION SOME_SERVICE ; then
        TRY_TO_CONFIG_IT
    fi

But currently, is_ovn_service_enabled doesn't work as expected, since it
will always return 0 if ovn is enabled and no matter what kind of sub-
service it is.

Think more, since "enable_service ovn" doesn't enable any service indeed,
it makes sense to replace is_ovn_service_enabled with is_service_enabled.
This patch is going to do that, and it will also fix logical error introduced
by is_ovn_service_enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1743487
Change-Id: Ic1213d0c93aea3f73f8c092b3ffb69ff23382735

Address an issue where the __repr__ method for v1 and v2 versions of
service.list() throw an uncaught AttributeError when looking for the
'service' attribute.  This update uses the 'binary' attribute instead.

commit_message:
Fix Service.__repr__ to use 'binary' field

Address an issue where the __repr__ method for v1 and v2 versions of
service.list() throw an uncaught AttributeError when looking for the
'service' attribute.  This update uses the 'binary' attribute instead.
Also added a unit test which would have found this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1315606
Change-Id: I640b88afa3ea74b02867b38661cc390506ccd066

Currently all services are setup in the haproxy configuration,
even if there are no back-ends for it.

This patch implements the use of the service enablement by
validating whether the service is in the inventory.

Additional checks are done for glance-registry to validate
whether it's needed.

Closes-Bug: #1742717
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only configure a service for haproxy when appropriate

Currently all services are setup in the haproxy configuration,
even if there are no back-ends for it.

This patch implements the use of the service enablement by
validating whether the service is in the inventory.

Additional checks are done for glance-registry to validate
whether it's needed.

Change-Id: Ie192cbe3b24573063aff93e9acfcefa92030504f
Closes-Bug: #1742717

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 03:26:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'spec for resource deleting

1. What is the problem?
During the deletion of a network which is mapped to several local networks, if
the local neutron server receives a network-get request, it will bring some
conflict operations. For example, we delete local networks before deleting
central network. If a "get_network" request comes to a local neutron server
after the local network is completely deleted in that region, if central
network is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local
networks), Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local
network will be recreated.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The solution to resource deleting is covered in this specification.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I4f29ee9f214242262bffc616dc60c8fdde76a6f6
Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

conflict operations. For example, we delete local networks before deleting
central network. If a "get_network" request comes to a local neutron server
after the local network is completely deleted in that region, if central
network is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local
networks), Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local
network will be recreated.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The solution to resource deleting is covered in this specification.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I4f29ee9f214242262bffc616dc60c8fdde76a6f6
Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: CR_hui <CR_hui@126.com>

commit_message:
spec for resource deleting

1. What is the problem?
During the deletion of a network which is mapped to several local networks, if
the local neutron server receives a network-get request, it will bring some
conflict operations. For example, we delete local networks before deleting
central network. If a "get_network" request comes to a local neutron server
after the local network is completely deleted in that region, if central
network is still there (assuming it takes certain time to delete all local
networks), Tricircle will also query central neutron and the deleted local
network will be recreated.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The solution to resource deleting is covered in this specification.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I4f29ee9f214242262bffc616dc60c8fdde76a6f6
Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: CR_hui <CR_hui@126.com>

commit_message:
Add rescuewait timeout periodic task

Ensure nodes don't get stuck in rescuewait forever when
a rescue ramdisk fails to boot and start heartbeating.

Change-Id: I15a92c0f619505e25768dc2fbc1b2a796f0b38fa
Related-bug: #1526449
Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>

commit_message:
Distinguish between PUT and PATCH in API models

At some point years ago, whether by design or by mistake,
the API models have conflated PUT (replace) and PATCH (update) [1].

This patch cleans up the models by making a clear distinction.
All the existing PUT implementations confusingly named update
are changed to replace.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/e81e63966baf5f6ff6e2e861e711478696076de4/congress/api/webservice.py#L203

Change-Id: I6786c39b7555c3b854ef90cb49d0ccb23f6f5bb2

commit_message:
Unify and fix `list_traces` function

1. Remove `filter` parameter from `list_traces` function, since
   filtering is heavily depends on a backend and cannot be (easily)
   made uniform.
2. Unify the output of `list_traces` - the function returns a list
   of `traces`, where each trace is a dictionary with at least `base_id`
   and `timestamp` fields.
3. Fix `list_traces` in Redis driver, so it returns only traces, instead
   of events.
4. Add functional test for `list_traces` in Redis driver.

Change-Id: Ia81540288fe98fd9b8e256c62cc372fa33fcbea3

subject: Mistral driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 22:49:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Mistral driver

Mistral driver and unit tests. Allows congress to
create workflows and trigger execution in Mistral.

By default, datasource retrieves mistral data from only the provided
user project. This behavior is useful when the mistral datasource is
used mainly for the admin to execute and track workflows/actions.
In that case, the admin would not want the workflow_executions table
to be innundated with executions triggered in other projects.

On the other hand, a mistral datasource can also be used to provide
policy-based monitoring and enforcement on the mistral usage by all
projects. For this purpose, the datasource behavior can be overridden
with the config option all_projects=True, to retrieve data from all
projects.

However, there is a limitation that the actions and action_executions
tables currently cannot obey the all_projects=True config because
mistral API lacks support. The limitation is documented in docstring
and will also be documented in doc.

Also configures mistral for gate integration tests.
Tempest tests in separate patch.

Implements blueprint add-mistral-driver

Change-Id: I77df90d41d7dbaf2583c32e809109c37f2dac6a0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-24 00:10:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'playbooks/legacy/congress-devstack-api-base/run.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/congress-pe-replicated-base/run.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/congress-devstack-py35-api-mysql/run.yaml', 'congress/datasources/mistral_driver.py', '.zuul.yaml', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_mistral_driver.py'], 'message': 'Mistral driver

user project. This behavior is useful when the mistral datasource is
used mainly for the admin to execute and track workflows/actions.
In that case, the admin would not want the workflow_executions table
to be innundated with executions triggered in other projects.

On the other hand, a mistral datasource can also be used to provide
policy-based monitoring and enforcement on the mistral usage by all
projects. For this purpose, the datasource behavior can be overridden
with the config option all_projects=True, to retrieve data from all
projects.

However, there is a limitation that the actions and action_executions
tables currently cannot obey the all_projects=True config because
mistral API lacks support. The limitation is documented in docstring
and will also be documented in doc.

Also configures mistral for gate integration tests.
Tempest tests in separate patch.

Implements blueprint add-mistral-driver

Change-Id: I77df90d41d7dbaf2583c32e809109c37f2dac6a0
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Mistral driver

Mistral driver and unit tests. Allows congress to
create workflows and trigger execution in Mistral.

By default, datasource retrieves mistral data from only the provided
user project. This behavior is useful when the mistral datasource is
used mainly for the admin to execute and track workflows/actions.
In that case, the admin would not want the workflow_executions table
to be innundated with executions triggered in other projects.

On the other hand, a mistral datasource can also be used to provide
policy-based monitoring and enforcement on the mistral usage by all
projects. For this purpose, the datasource behavior can be overridden
with the config option all_projects=True, to retrieve data from all
projects.

However, there is a limitation that the actions and action_executions
tables currently cannot obey the all_projects=True config because
mistral API lacks support. The limitation is documented in docstring
and will also be documented in doc.

Also configures mistral for gate integration tests.
Tempest tests in separate patch.

Implements blueprint add-mistral-driver

Change-Id: I77df90d41d7dbaf2583c32e809109c37f2dac6a0

commit_message:
Handle resource deletion properly

Fill status code and request id from upstream response directly into our
response. Also use general error message for deletion, since there could
be other errors than not found from upstream.

Change-Id: I1687fecd4ebcd6d8fd4c53b29e496c778314eb17

commit_message:
tasks: galera_post_install: Configure the service before securing the DB

The DB secure tool attempts to start the DB but this may fail if the
systemd service is not configured properly. As such, we move the service
configuration tasks before those that secure the db.

Change-Id: I49f5cee0494b89d5018056fbed84f52a67aa7399

subject: templates: hostfile-setup: Improve regexp for host entries
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 14:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openstack-host-hostfile-setup.sh.j2'], 'message': 'templates: hostfile-setup: Improve regexp for host entries

A hosts line may contain tabs instead of spaces and the '\ .*' regexp
doesn't match on that case. As such, we can improve the regexp to simply
look for any character after matching the address word. This fixes the
following problem when an entry with a tab exists in the file

~$ cat -Et /etc/hosts|head -n1
127.0.0.1^Ilocalhost$

The entry is not updated by the script leading to the following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "assertion": "'127.0.1.1 localhost.openstack.local localhost' in hosts_content",
    "changed": false,
    "evaluated_to": false
}

Change-Id: I23d22cbf4317a3c9228bcdb6b3e9e6c2238fcfb7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
templates: hostfile-setup: Improve regexp for host entries

A hosts line may contain tabs instead of spaces and the '\ .*' regexp
doesn't match on that case. As such, we can improve the regexp to simply
look for any character after matching the address word. This fixes the
following problem when an entry with a tab exists in the file

~$ cat -Et /etc/hosts|head -n1
127.0.0.1^Ilocalhost$

The entry is not updated by the script leading to the following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "assertion": "'127.0.1.1 localhost.openstack.local localhost' in hosts_content",
    "changed": false,
    "evaluated_to": false
}

Change-Id: I23d22cbf4317a3c9228bcdb6b3e9e6c2238fcfb7

commit_message:
Don't run check-tripleo OVB jobs frm RH1 anymore

Jobs now run in RDO CI, we don't need RH1 cloud to run OVB jobs anymore.
We'll keep experimental jobs until a complete decomission.

Related-Bug: #1744763
Change-Id: I25dcc22563316e184577822609aa7457da1c1d12

If create a container without specifying a network,

to the current tenant, like 'private' at demo project).
However, if there is no tenant network available, Zun
will reject the request.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pick shared network if no tenant network

If create a container without specifying a network,
Zun will pick a tenant network (a network that belongs
to the current tenant, like 'private' at demo project).
However, if there is no tenant network available, Zun
will reject the request.
So this PS pick shared network if its available.

Change-Id: I24108c19765332e6fe72c013df47fa6891883e15
Closes-Bug: #1729072

commit_message:
Allow setting full mandatory access control in amphora

Currently this will set SELinux mode to Enforcing on RHEL variants

This allows to test all types of images, source/distribution with and
without security enforcing

Also sort some getopt options

Change-Id: If303181cf40247b050e60775254d958a055b3f0b

commit_message:
Add volumes_info and addresses to data model

Add volumes_info since capsule volume support volumes
attach now. The volume_info will be a dict that records
the attach info of container and volume. The addresses
will record the info about network, IP addresses, etc.

Part of blueprint introduce-compose

Change-Id: I024213b9db1486effcecbae4b065996898e3d24e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

commit_message:
Added an ALL is_metal scenario

This setup allows the AIO to test an all is_metal setup. At present the
repo-servers and haproxy are being run within a container. This is to
ensure remote retrieval of packages is functional and there are no vip
collisions.

Change-Id: I5368cb4a9bd20aca5c7e98792e8225244f1def97
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: replace the class path uuid based stack names with vnf names
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 11:33:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'replace the class path uuid based stack names with vnf names

Tacker uses the class path+file name+uuid as stack names to
uniquely identify the stacks for vnf create and vnf respawn workflow.
Tacker now mandates VNF names to be provided in API layer and will be
made unique. It is useful to base stack names based on vnf names for
debugging purposes. This affects the naming of nova instances as well.

commit_message:
replace the class path uuid based stack names with vnf names

Tacker uses the class path+file name+uuid as stack names to
uniquely identify the stacks for vnf create and vnf respawn workflow.
Tacker now mandates VNF names to be provided in API layer and will be
made unique. It is useful to base stack names based on vnf names for
debugging purposes. This affects the naming of nova instances as well.

Change-Id: If043ad8c6c356f3fa1d2f5648d3d861ff5006602
Closes-Bug: #1590215

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I4ad77632027438537a38d46145b389ef6de06c98

commit_message:
Allow defaults for Image/Flavor/RoleParameters in roles_data.yaml

This allows specific roles, e.g ComputeRealTime to specify defaults
where the services are the same as some existing roles but a different
image and/or configuration are needed.

Inspired by discussion of this requirement in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531739/

RoleParametersDefaults is merged with the user provided parameters
with precendence to user parameters, as this is a special parameter,
which contains a map of the actual parameters to be applied to a
role.

Partially Implements: blueprint tripleo-realtime
Change-Id: I6497144340d3b9276e6ed141d3bc655bfbbeb53c

commit_message:
Adds SSL/TLS everywhere for OpenDaylight

Enables TLS encryption between ODL and OVS, as well as Northbound ODL
communication with Neutron.

Implements: blueprint opendaylight-ssl-support

Depends-On: Id579aea77bf8d679b514ef9851af36d9170e93a1

Change-Id: I7c43f1358807f3ffeef2ddf29d0085ad55151dfe
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop logging tracebacks when the replicator runs out of handoffs

Otherwise, swift-in-the-small can fill up logs with

    object-replicator: Error syncing partition:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File ".../swift/obj/replicator.py", line 419, in update
        node = next(nodes)
    StopIteration

...which simultaneously sounds worse than it is and isn't helpful in
diagnosing/debugging the issue.

Change-Id: I2f5bb12f3704880df1750229425f64f419ff9aef

commit_message:
Implement external MariaDB and pre-configured Databases support

This change allows the following use cases:

1. Using an already-configured MariaDB / MySQL server / Cluster
2. Using already-created DB users, without requiring root DB access.

Update: added external mariadb precheck

Change-Id: I78b0d178306d7c5293b0bf53e445f19f18b4b824
Implements: blueprint external-mariadb-support.
Closes-Bug: #1603121

Remove Certificate Orders and CAs from API

Removes Certificate Orders and CAs from the Barbican
API Controller. This patch also removes any tests associated
with those controllers.

[{'created': '2017-12-30 10:05:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reraise NGS exceptions seen during netmiko config

In netmiko device configuration, the existing approach of raising a new
exception with a message wrapping the old exception has the effect of
burying the original error. In some cases, the wrapper exception
GenericSwitchNetmikoConnectError might not be applicable - not all
errors are connection errors.

Following this change, when the exception raised is a subclass of the
NGS base exception, we reraise it.

This change also fixes some issues with the unit test for the netmiko
configuration save.

commit_message:
Reraise NGS exceptions seen during netmiko config

In netmiko device configuration, the existing approach of raising a new
exception with a message wrapping the old exception has the effect of
burying the original error. In some cases, the wrapper exception
GenericSwitchNetmikoConnectError might not be applicable - not all
errors are connection errors.

Following this change, when the exception raised is a subclass of the
NGS base exception, we reraise it.

This change also fixes some issues with the unit test for the netmiko
configuration save.

Change-Id: Id0142865341bd4f3cb5195a0ba6a4477b0dd0dc6

commit_message:
Ensure actions are setup before pre_approve

Fixes an issue where a failure during pre_approve will
incorrectly setup a task that can be revalidated and approved,
but should not be since actions will be missing.

Change-Id: I733f947851ec1dc6492ed2055df95d838d381e67
Closes-bug: bug/1745053

commit_message:
Pass binding:profile attribute as a string

Opendaylight defines the "binding:profile" attribute as a string
(see [1]), so in order to parse it we need to send it as one.
Openstack defines binding:profile as a dict that can hold several data
type values e.g string or list of strings therefore is sent as a string
and parsed in odl for specific attributes by their type.

[1] https://github.com/opendaylight/neutron/blob/7dd96afe5bee07c5e1b8f4aa2bfd5d25193de684/model/src/main/yang/neutron-binding.yang#L64

Change-Id: I560a70eb94495d466b03271d67e9c9191bac0a0e

subject: Fix break_on calculation in before_task_start
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-17 11:29:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix break_on calculation in before_task_start

RetryPolicy: prevent break_on from evaluation before task execution.
Sometimes expressions in break_on require existence of task execution
(see example in updated test). But if break_on is evaluated before

commit_message:
Fix break_on calculation in before_task_start

RetryPolicy: prevent break_on from evaluation before task execution.
Sometimes expressions in break_on require existence of task execution
(see example in updated test). But if break_on is evaluated before
first execution of task, it may end up with exception.

Change-Id: Ia836c0330dbed62954d79059df1bef3758f7c5e5
Signed-off-by: Anton Kazakov <ton.kazakov@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
More robust check for deployment_with_ha

The current check of "-pacemaker" being present in deployment command
is not sufficient for OOOQ based environments (and CI). Checking the
EnabledServices stack output should be somewhat more robust. We only
want deployment_with_ha if the deployment was with
pacemaker (pacemaker_present test) and we can't assume pacemaker is
the default (is_upstream test).

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8b0ff3797d8f6d697086701c80e1ae159cff2bf4

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: Iccbc833d821a2d7b2bc34860170ce1817fbecead

subject: Fix PING health monitor for old amphora
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 07:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/common/jinja/haproxy/test_jinja_cfg.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/sample_configs/sample_configs.py', 'octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/templates/base.j2'], 'message': 'Fix PING health monitor for old amphora

The previous PING health monitor patch had a bug that caused amphora
running an older version of the amphora-agent to fail even when running
non-ping health monitors.
This patch corrects that behavior to limit the issue to PING health

Change-Id: I83a3bf541c8c3c0f06544ef3228a5028756f51b3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix PING health monitor for old amphora

The previous PING health monitor patch had a bug that caused amphora
running an older version of the amphora-agent to fail even when running
non-ping health monitors.
This patch corrects that behavior to limit the issue to PING health
monitors as documented in the previous patch release note.

Change-Id: I83a3bf541c8c3c0f06544ef3228a5028756f51b3

commit_message:
Clean up a bit after the mapping inversion

The previous patch got the mapping inverted, but involved places where
CaseInsensitiveDict needed to be passed around. It's a quality of
Headers, so rework things to allow the dict type to be dictated by the
component class.

Add some helper methods that do common actions. These, and consume_attrs
can almost certainly be turned in to classmethods.

Remove calling filter_component or consume_attrs from limits - it's a
no-op. The Resource class handles this already.

Update the find_keypairs test. requires_id is a bit of a mess ...

Change-Id: Ic41f24fd70fb369370292c61a8867b31b8fd92ce

commit_message:
Make floating IP to be prefered over fixed when looking for IP

We can assume that floating IP is public IP address in clouds so
floating IPs should be checked first if they can be used to
connect to instance.

Change-Id: I1024d78e68a788bf5a92cb63d008c02180908dfa
Story: 2001475
Task: 6212
(cherry picked from commit 506b2f8adc431ae436201770e7dbfb135ed3e0e4)

commit_message:
OpenShift: Don't pre-install Docker

We installed docker our traditional way when deploying with Kubespray
and disabled Kubespray's management of Docker, because Kubespray
installs non-CentOS Docker binaries.

However, openshift-ansible installs Docker from CentOS, we don't need
to install it using the Docker composable service too. That way
openshift-ansible will be the authority on Docker configuration when
deploying OpenShift.

Change-Id: I1352d4050e2f38300068d858b19e0b4a31cf50a7
Related-Bug: #1741224

Set permissions for openstack keyring on CephPools

The openstack keyring needs permissions to operate on the additional
Ceph pools created using the CephPools parameter.

subject: Ensure that all release files are cleaned up when rebuilding
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 14:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_build_wheels.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure that all release files are cleaned up when rebuilding

Ansible 2.3 introduced a new option to the find module, but
in doing so they also implemented a breaking change.

Previously the find module would find both files and links
by default, but now it only finds files unless you tell it
specifically to find links.

As all the python wheels in the os-releases folder are links,
we tell the find module to find anything in the folder so
that the cleanup done is complete.

Change-Id: I6a63762f55782d8aeaa2a47aa55da21bc06ab431
(cherry picked from commit d9391e1f68027db2819c8d81e698a01a536c780f)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure that all release files are cleaned up when rebuilding

Ansible 2.3 introduced a new option to the find module, but
in doing so they also implemented a breaking change.

Previously the find module would find both files and links
by default, but now it only finds files unless you tell it
specifically to find links.

As all the python wheels in the os-releases folder are links,
we tell the find module to find anything in the folder so
that the cleanup done is complete.

Change-Id: I6a63762f55782d8aeaa2a47aa55da21bc06ab431
(cherry picked from commit d9391e1f68027db2819c8d81e698a01a536c780f)

subject: Properly match the LXC index item to download
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 17:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_preparation_systemd_new.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_preparation_systemd_old.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_prestage.yml'], 'message': "Properly match the LXC index item to download

Currently the match will return two results if the
variant to download is 'default' and the index
contains both 'default' and 'default-beta.1'. The
download task then downloads them both and the last
one wins.

This patch corrects the matching mechanism to ensure
that the match is properly delimited to prevent
improper matches.

This patch also ensures that only one download is done
if there are multiple matches. The list of results is
reverse sorted so that the most recent result is used.

Change-Id: I1086d41bd483d91d8d037a3ba8db4f92e738536e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Properly match the LXC index item to download

Currently the match will return two results if the
variant to download is 'default' and the index
contains both 'default' and 'default-beta.1'. The
download task then downloads them both and the last
one wins.

This patch corrects the matching mechanism to ensure
that the match is properly delimited to prevent
improper matches.

This patch also ensures that only one download is done
if there are multiple matches. The list of results is
reverse sorted so that the most recent result is used.

Change-Id: I1086d41bd483d91d8d037a3ba8db4f92e738536e

subject: Remove BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 19:01:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "When linking a release, re-bootstrap Ansible

Ensures that we're running the proper version
of Ansible when linking a release to run playbooks.

Also removes the BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable
since this would basically noop if you used any directory
other than /opt/openstack-ansible.

Change-Id: I284ad62b6f14cc334ae949946e839a1e8ec6a1d8
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-22 23:45:39.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/lib/functions.sh', 'leap-upgrades/lib/vars.sh'], 'message': 'Remove BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable

Removes the BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable because
the assumption was made that Ansible would always be
bootstrapped from /opt/openstack-ansible and setting
this would cause a noop when Ansible was bootstrapped.

Change-Id: I284ad62b6f14cc334ae949946e839a1e8ec6a1d8
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable

Removes the BOOTSTRAP_ANSIBLE_FOLDER variable because
the assumption was made that Ansible would always be
bootstrapped from /opt/openstack-ansible and setting
this would cause a noop when Ansible was bootstrapped.

Change-Id: I284ad62b6f14cc334ae949946e839a1e8ec6a1d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 21:01:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/backup.py'], 'message': "Fix Backup uses latest req-id for all log calls

Currently all log entries will have the request ID of the latest request
that was received in the Backup service.

So you would receive a request with ID 1 and you would start logging
that thread log calls with its ID, but as soon as you receive another
request, let's say with ID 2, you will have both request logging with ID
2 instead of each one logging with its own request ID.

The reason for this is that we are monkey patching after we have
imported OSLO logging and we should be doing the monkey patching before,
because OSLO logging imports OSLO context, which in turn imports
threading and defines the _request_store where the context is stored as
threading.local, which is not the monkey patched version and therefore
will be shared among all the greenthreads that share the same python
thread.

To fix this we just move the monkey patching earlier in the imports.

Closes-Bug: #1743461
Change-Id: I677a8e39de4292fe4fa8e70d7b6ae2fc3d5cf2ac
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Backup uses latest req-id for all log calls

Currently all log entries will have the request ID of the latest request
that was received in the Backup service.

So you would receive a request with ID 1 and you would start logging
that thread log calls with its ID, but as soon as you receive another
request, let's say with ID 2, you will have both request logging with ID
2 instead of each one logging with its own request ID.

The reason for this is that we are monkey patching after we have
imported OSLO logging and we should be doing the monkey patching before,
because OSLO logging imports OSLO context, which in turn imports
threading and defines the _request_store where the context is stored as
threading.local, which is not the monkey patched version and therefore
will be shared among all the greenthreads that share the same python
thread.

To fix this we just move the monkey patching earlier in the imports.

Closes-Bug: #1743461
Change-Id: I677a8e39de4292fe4fa8e70d7b6ae2fc3d5cf2ac

commit_message:
sixer unicode text string

As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3, in Python 3,
it's a Unicode text string.
So deleted the 'u' in sixer module usage.

Change-Id: I105d20b4259360f0fb4185cd9092a84e02f80af4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 20:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nl02.openstack.org.yaml'], 'message': "Disable infracloud-chocolate on nl02.o.o

Our controller in infracloud-chocolate has stopped replying to
requests. Currently we don't know what is happening, and access to iLo
card for the server isn't responding.

It maybe possible the hardware was pawered off or failure of HDDs. For
now, disable the provider and see if we can get any feedback from HPE.

Change-Id: Iffb7bed95b5e4ab9be17cb210b5f78e445cdab1c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Disable infracloud-chocolate on nl02.o.o

Our controller in infracloud-chocolate has stopped replying to
requests. Currently we don't know what is happening, and access to iLo
card for the server isn't responding.

It maybe possible the hardware was pawered off or failure of HDDs. For
now, disable the provider and see if we can get any feedback from HPE.

Change-Id: Iffb7bed95b5e4ab9be17cb210b5f78e445cdab1c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Cleanup the gate-check-commit dstat part
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 15:41:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': "Cleanup the gate-check-commit dstat part

Following the advice given in review [1], we could put the
conditional inside the scripts-library to simplify the behavior
inside the gate-check-commit script.

On top of that, if we pipe to || true, the function wouldn't
fail on branches where the function/vars are not defined,
cleaning the code further.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531131/2

Change-Id: Icda339747267cf6bf514d45878c26533b5341f83
(cherry picked from commit 7f192b104f3c27fddfc2f86b9b7d61e9222b124c)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cleanup the gate-check-commit dstat part

Following the advice given in review [1], we could put the
conditional inside the scripts-library to simplify the behavior
inside the gate-check-commit script.

On top of that, if we pipe to || true, the function wouldn't
fail on branches where the function/vars are not defined,
cleaning the code further.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531131/2

Change-Id: Icda339747267cf6bf514d45878c26533b5341f83
(cherry picked from commit 7f192b104f3c27fddfc2f86b9b7d61e9222b124c)

commit_message:
WIP - collectd chart to collect metrics

collectd Python plugin has been utilized in this chart to
collect openstack api check metrics. Metrics yet to be implemented:
IPMI, AMQP, MySQL, Port Check metrics, URL GET metrics etc.

Change-Id: I9620b89ebf6d1933ff26c375adb7c37cd66efdc2
Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: fix worker cleanup

The subcriptions from a worker where not properly
cleared up on worker cleanup, failing to call the
callbacks allowing the withdrawal of RTC routes.

Change-Id: Id61d9bb5c03a9d2eff11f7188a6ef5df60c3f3a3

commit_message:
Add tests for update group types for volume module

This PS adds a test for update_group_types for the corresponding
Cinder API that was recently added to Tempest [0] and whose policy
is [1].

This PS also rearranges some tests in the related class so that
the tests are bunched together by policy name.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/1879cc7aa733f38bc5eba1d126bd320dfeaa1a90/tempest/lib/services/volume/v3/group_types_client.py#L79
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/280e59c5b6c953228dcba52b21587b82f7f5f93b/cinder/policies/group_types.py#L38

Change-Id: Ie9bf27c9e9c392ebb2011800e5ce5c1450c3df75

commit_message:
Bump API microversion to 3.50

This change is to bump MAX_VERSION to
3.50 in api_version.  This bump is necessary to
keep cinderclient in sync with cinder which moved
to 3.50 with change: f1bfd9790d2a7cac9a3e66417b11dc8e3edd8109

With MV 3.50 we are able to request multiple attachments for
a single volume.

Change-Id: Ic51b890b816112cecaedd68df8d13ec175623c66

commit_message:
New configuration being added for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

Cisco UCSM ML2 driver now accepts the following new configuration
parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Change-Id: I974c51a4bee4dc2e084cea809b3f93978d09c63b
Closes-Bug: #1742796

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 14:28:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Fullstack] SG test use not too many fake hosts

In fullstack security groups test number of used fake hosts depends
on scenario.
For example for ovs-hybrid scenario only one such host is enough
because all ports are placed on first host always.
So there is no need to spawn another L2 and DHCP agents for such test.

Change-Id: Icfcf54bf9d7cc954aaa20b22d1f1746afc61179c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-22 20:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': '[Fullstack] SG test use not too many fake hosts

In fullstack security groups test number of used fake hosts depends
on scenario.
For example for ovs-hybrid scenario only one such host is enough
because all ports are placed on first host always.
So there is no need to spawn another L2 and DHCP agents for such test.

Change-Id: Icfcf54bf9d7cc954aaa20b22d1f1746afc61179c
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] SG test use not too many fake hosts

In fullstack security groups test number of used fake hosts depends
on scenario.
For example for ovs-hybrid scenario only one such host is enough
because all ports are placed on first host always.
So there is no need to spawn another L2 and DHCP agents for such test.

Change-Id: Icfcf54bf9d7cc954aaa20b22d1f1746afc61179c

commit_message:
Fix use of new openstacksdk connection

We store the created conn on the instance, but we never pull it back off
if there is already one present.

Change-Id: I2d890dd206d4ddf67fa42d798e6fd2c652799785

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: allow updating local_pref

Update the vi_plugged code so that when an
existing (max,ip) endpoint is plugged again,
it's route is resynthesized.

This allows having the route readvertised
with possibly an updated local_pref values.

Change-Id: If223a47a683b2b6ecb131dc8bbeb8be8e7423858

commit_message:
disable glance voting on py27 tests

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536070 is a test bug demonstrating
that their gate is failing.  We have freeze this week and can't have
fails like this holding us back.  Also remove it from the gate
pipeline to reduce gate load.

Change-Id: Ie2733fa7ed4f45de9184095a12d3c9841c3e2177
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2018-01-18 12:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/segments/db.py'], 'message': 'Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948

', 'number': 47}, {'created': '2018-01-09 04:44:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: [api] Allow multi-attach in compute api

TODO: tests

Add new API microversion to indicate the support added to attach
a single Cinder volume to multiple VM instances.

This change introduces the 2.59 microversion which must be used
to create a server from a multiattach volume or attach a multiattach
volume to an existing server instance.

Attaching a multiattach volume to a shelved offloaded instance is not
supported since an instance in that state does not have a compute host
so we can't tell if the compute would support the multiattach volume
or not. This is consistent with the tagged attach validation with 2.49.

When creating a server from a multiattach volume, we'll check to see
if all computes in all cells are upgraded to the point of even supporting
the compute side changes, otherwise the server create request fails with
a 409.

Similarly, when attaching a multiattach volume to an existing instance,
if the compute isn't new enough to support multiattach or the virt
driver simply doesn't support the capability, a 409 response is returned.
Presumably, operators will use AZs/aggregates to organize which hosts
support multiattach if they have a mixed hypervisor deployment, or will
simply disable multiattach support via Cinder policy.

", 'number': 48}, {'created': '2018-01-09 17:05:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: [api] Allow multi-attach in compute api

TODO: tests

Add new API microversion to indicate the support added to attach
a single Cinder volume to multiple VM instances.

This change introduces the 2.59 microversion which must be used
to create a server from a multiattach volume or attach a multiattach
volume to an existing server instance.

Attaching a multiattach volume to a shelved offloaded instance is not
supported since an instance in that state does not have a compute host
so we can't tell if the compute would support the multiattach volume
or not. This is consistent with the tagged attach validation with 2.49.

When creating a server from a multiattach volume, we'll check to see
if all computes in all cells are upgraded to the point of even supporting
the compute side changes, otherwise the server create request fails with
a 409.

Similarly, when attaching a multiattach volume to an existing instance,
if the compute isn't new enough to support multiattach or the virt
driver simply doesn't support the capability, a 409 response is returned.
Presumably, operators will use AZs/aggregates to organize which hosts
support multiattach if they have a mixed hypervisor deployment, or will
simply disable multiattach support via Cinder policy.

commit_message:
[api] Allow multi-attach in compute api

This change introduces a new microversion which must be used
to create a server from a multiattach volume or attach a multiattach
volume to an existing server instance.

Attaching a multiattach volume to a shelved offloaded instance is not
supported since an instance in that state does not have a compute host
so we can't tell if the compute would support the multiattach volume
or not. This is consistent with the tagged attach validation with 2.49.

When creating a server from a multiattach volume, we'll check to see
if all computes in all cells are upgraded to the point of even supporting
the compute side changes, otherwise the server create request fails with
a 409. We do this because we don't know which compute node the scheduler
will pick and we don't have any compute capability filtering in the
scheduler for multiattach volumes (that may be a future improvement).

Similarly, when attaching a multiattach volume to an existing instance,
if the compute isn't new enough to support multiattach or the virt
driver simply doesn't support the capability, a 409 response is returned.
Presumably, operators will use AZs/aggregates to organize which hosts
support multiattach if they have a mixed hypervisor deployment, or will
simply disable multiattach support via Cinder policy.

The unit tests are covering error conditions with the new flow. A new
functional scenario test is added for happy path testing of the new boot
from multiattach volume flow and attaching a multiattach volume to more
than one instance.

Tempest integration testing for multiattach is added in change
I80c20914c03d7371e798ca3567c37307a0d54aaa.

Devstack support for multiattach is added in change
I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Implements: blueprint multi-attach-volume
Change-Id: I02120ef8767c3f9c9497bff67101e57e204ed6f4

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2018-01-18 16:01:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added transitions library to masakari intrusive-instance-monitoring

As the first step to get these defined in requirements.txt,
adding to global-requirements and upper-constraints.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, there are 38 contributors and all source is available on github.

* Is the library good code?

Code is well documented and tested.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it is using the MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Yes, I got it from Ubuntu latest

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
or infrastructure setup?

Masakari

* Do I need to update anything else?
No

commit_message:
Added transitions library to masakari intrusive-instance-monitoring

As the first step to get these defined in requirements.txt,
adding to global-requirements and upper-constraints.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, there are 38 contributors and all source is available on github.

* Is the library good code?

Code is well documented and tested.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it is using the MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Yes, I got it from Ubuntu latest

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

No, this function is not yet covered by other libraries.
The transitions library provides an object-oriented state machine
implementation which Compatible with Python 2.7+ and 3.0+.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
or infrastructure setup?

Masakari

* Do I need to update anything else?
No

Change-Id: I2f6e4abd248bf2b05fca5af7364e32d4fe452c31
Implements: blueprint intrusive-instance-monitoring

commit_message:
Unlink Asyncs older then reclaim_age

Any async_pendings that are older then reclaim_age
can cause ghost listings. This patch simply unlinks
asyncs older then reclaim_age to avoid this.

This is the simple version fix for the bug.

Change-Id: I7c4b4453b6a5a83561dcb550add969bcb4f0607e
Closes-Bug: #1619408

commit_message:
Capture /var/log/tripleo-config

This folder contains the json and manifest which drives the
puppet and container configuration, so this is useful in many cases
for debugging.

commit_message:
Rework amphora agent installation element

Merge source and RHEL elements, allowing both source and package based
installations.

Allow amphora agent install from distribution packages (not limited to
RHEL)

Add a new option to diskimage-create.sh script to do so (default is kept
to source installation from Octavia git tree)

For now, amphorae built with distribution packages will have SELinux
(when available) running in permissive mode.

Made the rebind-sshd element generic to streamline the script
Use POSIX syntax for logrotate kill command

Change-Id: I391b2a95d54c7b9fd8f31d3e2c136ff9cc3451f1

commit_message:
Switch to using PKCS12 for TLS Term certs

*NOT* deprecating the old way of storing these, as I believe that would
create a huge mess for anyone already using it.

Change-Id: I1fee174d8b8956f3d2053781a7f18c2940b21765

commit_message:
Add log-tag to haproxy config file

By adding a log-tag line to the haproxy config file that contains
the network or router id, we will be able to differentiate which
proxy is logging what.  This should help with debugging.

Change-Id: I5bb57b7682c00645e20cce69847dbb3b72165aa8
Partial-bug: #1744359

commit_message:
WIP: change devmode to deploy containerized services by default

** comprehensive patch **
with this change devmode will deploy containerized services in the
overcloud by default when devmode is not in gate mode.
Since gate for containerized deployments is still work in progress the
new default will not apply for gate mode. Gate mode will still deploy a
non containerized overcloud
Two options added to devmode.sh
--no-containerized-deployment to change the default for non-gate mode
--force-containerized-deployment to force containers even in gate mode
One option added to quickstart.sh
--featureset will specify the featureset

Depends-On: I1651ffb4bc01793eaea056c2f8d6fe7ba5a95f19
Change-Id: I147d2cd5713f254cedbb45b4099463c0a4b9b17c

commit_message:
Move custom_nameserver handling out of ovb

Since other non-ovb environments may also wish to use a non-google
DNS server for the undercloud, move custom_nameserver handling out
of the ovb task and into its own task.

Change-Id: I648ad7cf7eb5a15e8cbdb5f7ca7a8d31ec3f4936

commit_message:
WIP: Integrate devmode into quickstart.sh

Currently devmode.sh provides two extra function compared to
quickstart.sh:

* building and integrating changes into the deployed environment like
  gate jobs
* create environments on OVB clouds easily

This change integrates these functions back into quickstart.sh, making
it possible for developers to use the full possibilities available
through quickstart.sh. It also  extract the less central functions from
quickstart.sh into utility-functions.sh.

This change introduces --gate option that will ask the user question
about which change they want to integrate into deployed env.

The OVB function is not yet re-implemented.

Change-Id: Iaf40fab465564bc97047d71fc2001e2d65d6a773

commit_message:
Install Curator from RPM in MidoNet element

Due to some changes needed in the RDO side we refactored some code at
openstack/puppet-midonet so Elasticsearch Curator is installed from
their Yum repositories instead of it being installed with Pip.

See:
- https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1403753
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409862/
- https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/4053/

Change-Id: Ie7501ab0f6949e149b15791b9d3ba9d6370a6b00
(cherry picked from commit 164632aa195bba18612c6c1cf61791ca356a0a6a)

subject: Rerunnable multinode CI nic config
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-06 18:09:56.000000000', 'files': ['ci/common/net-config-multinode-os-net-config.yaml'], 'message': 'Rerunnable multinode CI nic config

Fixes a couple of issues with rerunning the nic config for TripleO CI
multinode environments.

- The br-ex bridge may not exist when we try to delete it, so use
  --if-exists.
- Forcibly delete all br-ex configuration under
  /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts so that os-net-config is triggered to
  recreate the config and ifdown/ifup the interface.

Change-Id: I643619cbae9cc67050a4c5a0066050b968d660ac
Closes-Bug: #1702731
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rerunnable multinode CI nic config

Fixes a couple of issues with rerunning the nic config for TripleO CI
multinode environments.

- The br-ex bridge may not exist when we try to delete it, so use
  --if-exists.
- Forcibly delete all br-ex configuration under
  /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts so that os-net-config is triggered to
  recreate the config and ifdown/ifup the interface.

Change-Id: I643619cbae9cc67050a4c5a0066050b968d660ac
Closes-Bug: #1702731

commit_message:
Add no-cleanup arg for overcloud deployment

For each deploy command, the cli creates a new temporary
tripleo-heat-templates dir, with the rendered jinja files
from the swift container. The dir is dropped at the end of
the deploy command.
The --no-cleanup option keeps this temp dir after the
deployment. It's very useful for debugging purpose to keep
and to let the collect-logs role gets this dir.

Change-Id: I077918f9264fa6a3275e9d7ed5f8a96a504f910c

commit_message:
Calculate both create and update times for heat resources

Previously heat-deploy-times.py only handled CREATE* events.  Since
the update time can also be useful to look at, let's include those
numbers too.

Change-Id: I2a2b557a408b82d7f2151a4ae3aad7f1afbe663f

commit_message:
adapt neutron sanity check to containerized environment

there is a new list for container-based config files and also
update to the validation code.
the code tests if there are neutron containers. by this condition
the code will choose whether to take the baremetal paths
or the container-based paths.

Change-Id: I3c4cfbd9698fc349a8f006922a4128618506cca8

commit_message:
Use updated multi-nic configs in THT

In the depends-on patch, we move the nic configs for multi-nic
network isolation to THT. This patch changes our deploy args to
make use of them.

Change-Id: I75450641d0a3413ce01b5632dd2a26580e7be3d9
Depends-On: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

* tempest.api.compute.servers.test_create_server.
  ServersTestBootFromVolume.test_verify_created_server_vcpus test
  finds cpuinfo of the instance created by boot from volume by ssh
  into it. This tests replaces the ping test. In order to run the
  test, we need to enable validation.run_validation to true in

* For running test_server_basic_ops tests we need to enable

* Added ssh_timeout to 200 in order to perfrom ssh into the
  instance and to avoid request time out.

Change-Id: I7f47f499c9b0377777629635c220806da7112426
', 'number': 6}]
commit_message:
Enable additional params for scenario/tempest ping test.

* tempest.api.compute.servers.test_create_server.
  ServersTestBootFromVolume.test_verify_created_server_vcpus test
  finds cpuinfo of the instance created by boot from volume by ssh
  into it. This tests replaces the ping test. In order to run the
  test, we need to enable validation.run_validation to true in
  tempest.conf so that tempest tests can ssh and run the tests
  otherwise this test will be skipped.

* For running test_server_basic_ops tests we need to enable
  validation.run_validation to true as well as
  compute_feature_enabled.config_drive to true otherwise
  it will fail.

* Remove validation.ssh_user in favour validation.image_ssh_user

* Added ssh_timeout to 200 in order to perfrom ssh into the
  instance and to avoid request time out.

Change-Id: I7f47f499c9b0377777629635c220806da7112426

commit_message:
add note to not run quickstart from the ssh_user (stack)

The ssh_user is ephemeral and can be removed by quickstart.
It is not recommended or supported to use root or ssh_user (stack)

Change-Id: I8c50924f1ad9e75f25f414ad2c71d81a46f1d3f2

commit_message:
Post deployment installation instructions for Octavia

While Octavia services are installed, full Octavia support is
in-progress. This documentation describes general steps necessary to get
the system ready for creating load balancers.

Depends-On: If483d0ee027596999370ab0d21b1743d4ef16acb
Change-Id: I734b6a8a336d527a71bf2c5bb8bca47ba3a27bd6

commit_message:
Adding scenarios tests in default regex

Adding these tests in the regex, will remove the gab between what
tripleo test and what OSP QE test.
Also, we can avoid much more issues running scenarios on experimental
job.

Change-Id: Idfedc075c2475f88493ed449067dbf161d489e0c

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

tripleo-common already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ia705ae7092dbcbb669768460bf2ff909ce612605

Two new parameters are added:

custom_yaml: []
custom_yaml_args: ""

custom_yaml is an array, containing the list of the custom yamls that

  - storage-custom.yaml

custom_yaml_args gets added at the end of the deploy command line and is

commit_message:
Add the ability to load custom yaml(s)

This commit adds the ability for a user to load custom yaml from the
working directory to the undercloud and to automatically add this (or
these) new yaml to the deploy command line.
Two new parameters are added:

custom_yaml: []
custom_yaml_args: ""

custom_yaml is an array, containing the list of the custom yamls that
must exist locally, like:

custom_yaml:
  - storage-custom.yaml
  - other-custom.yaml

custom_yaml_args gets added at the end of the deploy command line and is
automatically populated by the pre-deploy task.

Change-Id: I636915bc5e11d9f61067116fbec43b5486899bb1

commit_message:
bagpipe v2 driver

The behavior of the current "v1" bagpipe driver is to
produce both the old and new RPCs to not prevent rolling
upgrades.

This change introduces a bagpipe v2 driver that does not
produce old RPCs and only relies on OVO push/pull RPCs.

To avoid code duplication of the code for new RPCs,
the current driver is refactored to inherits from the
v2 driver the code for the new OVO push/pull RPCs.

The current v1 driver is also modified to raise a warning
indicating its future removal.

This change also extends the previous unit test
coverage for the production of push-based RPCs.

Change-Id: I708ec1e4d8a8c27ffe8c4be172812e0a9aed54b4

commit_message:
Add check on download_overcloud_templates_rpm to trigger custom-tht

The custom-tht is trigger only when:
overcloud_templates_repo is defined and overcloud_templates_refspec
or overcloud_templates_branch
So it skip the mixed deployment when we want to get the tht rpm
outside of the undercloud repo to deploy the overcloud with it
Adding the download_overcloud_templates_rpm with a logical or

commit_message:
Use sub_nodes_private

Use the private interfaces of test envs rather than public. This avoids
using NAT and is the piece we have compatible files in place for zuulv3

commit_message:
Removes unicode 'u' response for "cinder get-capabilities"

The output of "cinder get-capabilities" command returns
unicoded response. But it would appear from the utils
class that setting formatters will go through the
capabilities dict and make sure all values are properly
string formatted. Therefore added formatters to return
string formatted response.

Added formatters=sorted(prop.keys()) line instead of
static values as suggested by the reviewer, to avoid
tying server knowledge to the client and also any
update on the server side would easily reflect here.

Closes-bug: #1680444
Change-Id: Ie38236db364d59ddab42cb925d0435777b0ffe86

commit_message:
show values at -eol tags as well as on branches

Sometimes we want to go further back in history than the current open
branches, so include the -eol tags as well.

Change-Id: Idb7ca9d0f4dd2f7dc6701577cc495a8010ee1340
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
blueprint tripleo-predictable-ctlplane-ips

Spec: User-specifiable Control Plane IP on Routed Isolated Networks

This spec describes the features required for selecting a specific IP
to use for the Control Plane IP on each node in a TripleO deployment.
The implementation will involve adding parameters for the subnet and
fixed_ip of the Control Plane, along with examples and documentation.

CI will need to be updated to test this feature when it merges.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I548a5592486d49c17f4cdb29ec41537b4f406b9c

subject: Make create_server tests more policy-granular
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-13 23:27:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make create_test_server in Patrole more policy granular

This PS adds a classmethod helper to Patrole's compute rbac_base
module to make create_test_server more policy granular.

This helper method is useful for avoiding extra policy actions being
enforced when calling ``self.create_test_server.`` To accomplish this,
do:

    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self):
        server = self.create_test_server()  # wait_until is None.
    self.wait_for_server_status(server, status='ACTIVE')

Note that this should only be used in cases where
``self.create_test_server`` is called within the above contextmanager.

This PS makes necessary changes to tests that use wait_until='ACTIVE'
inside the override_role contextmanager.

Note that further refactoring for edge cases like creating a validatable
server is not required because Patrole doesn't currently have relevant
test scenarios that need it.

However, work still needs to be done to make volume-backed server
creatiom atomic, which currently involves creating a volume and
waiting for it to become active within the same contextmanager scope.

Change-Id: I299db38b1ab8f5233de44643aca052b9c34bb7ce

commit_message:
Make create_server tests more policy-granular

This PS makes the tests in test_create_serve rmore policy-granular
by removing create_test_server from the ``override_role`` contextmanager
blocks because the function can call many different policies.

Change-Id: I299db38b1ab8f5233de44643aca052b9c34bb7ce

commit_message:
change the kill mode for vitrage-graph service

since vitrage graph creates child processes we
want to kill the children processes if systemd cannot
stop the service

Change-Id: I93a5d680fe93b929f9bc83489d7edb636205846d

and /plugins/ml2/plugin.py.

subject: enable ovn metadata in computenode conf sample
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 10:46:36.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/computenode-local.conf.sample'], 'message': 'enable ovn metadata in computenode conf sample

This patch enables networking-ovn-metadata-agent service in
devstack/computenode-local.conf.sample.
It should be recommanded to enable metadata agent for supporting
nova metadata api by default.

Change-Id: Iaea7cbe7683cfcf8ce3000a1715bc86eda2347c9
Closes-Bug: 1743536
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
enable ovn metadata in computenode conf sample

This patch enables networking-ovn-metadata-agent service in
devstack/computenode-local.conf.sample.
It should be recommanded to enable metadata agent for supporting
nova metadata api by default.

Change-Id: Iaea7cbe7683cfcf8ce3000a1715bc86eda2347c9
Closes-Bug: 1743536

commit_message:
Remove inner_exceptions plumbing

We've finally gotten out of the business of wrapping exceptions. Since
we don't do that anymore, we don't need the log_inner_exceptions logic.

Change-Id: Id1f709daa2e61c13efeeeffc2a08578c27265e56

commit_message:
Switch to neutron-tempest-plugin for tempest tests

* https://review.openstack.org/519310 syncs the code from neutron
  project to neutron-tempest-plugin repo and it is better to depend
  on new one inorder to avoid the breakage.

Change-Id: Icf3ec7c186f45e86d602d5bc8754b91ddab47732

commit_message:
Add doc8 to pep8 check for glance project

This patch adds a doc8 check of .rst files to the current pep8 check.
It includes fixes to the .rst files that didn't pass the check.

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a9299200202576d97760ebf07bceb930888f2d7

commit_message:
Updating for new sphinx docs jobs

There have been recent changes to how docs jobs are run under zuul [1].
This patch updates neutron-lbaas-dashboard to be able to run under the
new zuul docs jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508694/

Change-Id: I482b4904838f39e7e32eb499ef9a29a4ec349522

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I74575c6c6796f875bd4b5b36ced1563c46fb2e47

commit_message:
Add tempest-stress in Quality Assurance

tempest-stress is to perform stress testing of cloud using tempest.
This framework used to be in tempest earlier but due to tempest scope
it had been moved out of tempest tree. During queens PTG (even earlier)
we discussed to make it in separate repo.

Depends-On: I063303642f5c99e4ca95d0e02c2360a003688ad6
Change-Id: Ib6fb2eac8568f6e86aae24782bfa6d9cca4fe54c

commit_message:
Stop abusing [keystone_authtoken]

That config section should be private for keystonemiddleware, so deprecate and
discourage its use for trusts creation.

Create a new config section for credentials to create trusts with.

Change-Id: I93b9a9b4c8003463c33439f116b9a72619512b98

subject: Render deprecated policy names when generating files
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 22:56:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
with the current policy check string if the policy is deprecated.
This makes it so that operators don't have to change two policies
if they override a deprecated policy.

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b

commit_message:
Render deprecated policy names when generating files

We found out the when policy files are generated they don't have
deprecated policies. This can be problematic for services that use
rendered policy files because they could still be using the
deprecated policy name and not the new policy name.

This commit makes sure we render the deprecated policy name
as an alias to the new policy name. This makes it so that operators
don't have to change two policies if they override a deprecated
policy.

Closes-Bug: 1742569

Change-Id: Iaf0c89a035775770ceaa230c65ce8eb195b9d82b

subject: Add support for microversion 2.60 - volume multiattach
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 23:27:59.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/__init__.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Add support for microversion 2.60 - volume multiattach

There are no client-side changes for this, we're just
registering the microversion support. Someone would have
to use this microversion when trying to attach a multiattach
capable volume to a server.

Related nova API change: I02120ef8767c3f9c9497bff67101e57e204ed6f4

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Iff590954e7e12ee630140024f70c98d3cfa14a31
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.60 - volume multiattach

There are no client-side changes for this, we're just
registering the microversion support. Someone would have
to use this microversion when trying to attach a multiattach
capable volume to a server.

Related nova API change: I02120ef8767c3f9c9497bff67101e57e204ed6f4

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Iff590954e7e12ee630140024f70c98d3cfa14a31

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: Iacc3d0abc383f2ce76d9be68aecf29b300a2434f

commit_message:
Fix log-enable high priority error

1. Modify setup.cfg to make command openstack database log enable run
correctlly. class EnableDatabaseInstanceLog should be in database_instances,
not in database_limits. This is a HIGH priority error.

2. Originally, trove log-enable will return a log info when execute successfully.
This change makes OSC log_enable acts like the origin troveclient enable_log.

Change-Id: I68c5ef451c8e6c7fb189d6270bad002da7ffc9a6

subject: Wrong PID filename for PostgreSQL in Ubuntu image
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 15:29:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wrong PID filename for PostgreSQL in Ubuntu image

The PostgreSQL 9.4 build on Ubuntu Xenial doesn't work correctly with
the way how the Trove guest agent is configured.

Trove guest agent is looking for a PID named "postgresql.pid" but the one
configured by default in PostgreSQL is "*-main.pid" where * is the version.

Changing only the systemd unit file is not enough, the "postgresql.conf" as
to be changed too.

Changing external_pid_file option from /etc/postgresql/*/main/postgresql.conf
solved the issue.

Change-Id: I5957f07f5e21f3ed6a23c5fe59e167f006a4fca9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-18 15:32:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wrong PID filename for PostgreSQL in Ubuntu image

the way how the Trove guest agent is configured.

Trove guest agent is looking for a PID named "postgresql.pid" but the one
configured by default in PostgreSQL is "*-main.pid" where * is the version.

Changing only the systemd unit file is not enough, the "postgresql.conf" as
to be changed too.

Changing external_pid_file option from /etc/postgresql/*/main/postgresql.conf
solved the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1744098

Change-Id: I5957f07f5e21f3ed6a23c5fe59e167f006a4fca9

commit_message:
Wrong PID filename for PostgreSQL in Ubuntu image

The PostgreSQL 9.4 build on Ubuntu Xenial doesn't work correctly with
the way how the Trove guest agent is configured.

Trove guest agent is looking for a PID named "postgresql.pid" but the
one configured by default in PostgreSQL is "*-main.pid" where * is
the version.

Changing only the systemd unit file is not enough,
the "postgresql.conf" as to be changed too.

Changing external_pid_file option from
/etc/postgresql/*/main/postgresql.conf solved the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1744098
Change-Id: I5957f07f5e21f3ed6a23c5fe59e167f006a4fca9

commit_message:
WIP: Add fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for ceilometer services

Adds ffu_tasks for ceilometer - stop services on step 2
and package updates on step 6. In the docker/ templates
services are also disabled. Since there is no -api template
the package update is with each service rather than -api as
is the pattern on the other ffu_tasks (see topic branch).

Lots of changes for ceilo-* since Newton:
  --> openstack-ceilometer-api, -collector and -expirer are
      removed in Pike and no longer in the templates. The disable
      files are re-added by the parent review so these services
      can be retired with ffu_tasks.
  --> openstack-ceilometer-agent-ipmi is new in pike and needs to
      be installed.

Change-Id: I47acc63c2e5b710a95a0c1197cde3a25a07ab273

subject: Clean up exception message raised by policy authority module
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 01:43:06.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/test_policy_authority.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/policy_authority.py'], 'message': 'Clean up exception message raised by policy authority module

This PS cleans up an exception message raised by policy authority
module because it is innacurate. When a policy isn't found,
the current message says something like:

Policy action: group:reset_group_snapshot not found in policy file:
None. [0]

However, this isn't very helpful as in this case no custom policy
file is used and besides that, the policy in code is used as a source
for finding the policy. So the message has been changed to (e.g.):

Policy action "group:reset_group_snapshot" not found in policy file:
None or among registered policy in code defaults for service.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/12/536612/2/check/patrole-admin/7367a52/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-23_00_15_27_996109

Change-Id: I754a03d57ae404877ad7521e25bf49a5cc7357b9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up exception message raised by policy authority module

This PS cleans up an exception message raised by policy authority
module because it is innacurate. When a policy isn't found,
the current message says something like:

Policy action: group:reset_group_snapshot not found in policy file:
None. [0]

However, this isn't very helpful as in this case no custom policy
file is used and besides that, the policy in code is used as a source
for finding the policy. So the message has been changed to (e.g.):

Policy action "group:reset_group_snapshot" not found in policy file:
None or among registered policy in code defaults for service.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/12/536612/2/check/patrole-admin/7367a52/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-23_00_15_27_996109

Change-Id: I754a03d57ae404877ad7521e25bf49a5cc7357b9

Sync charm-helpers

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings

* Zesty is EOL

commit_message:
Microversion 2.59 - Migrations list pagination

Add optional parameters 'limit', 'marker' and 'changes-since' to the
os-migrations endpoints for pagination.

  /os-migrations?limit={limit}&marker={migrations_uuid}
  /os-migrations?changes-since={changes-since}

Change-Id: I7437a61ee07c339b43d008204d1416044a407b68
Implement: blueprint add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list
Depends-on: I7e01f95d7173d9217f76e838b3ea71555151ef56

', 'number': 26}, {'created': '2018-01-16 15:14:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add rescue related methods to network interface

Adds methods `add_rescuing_network` and `remove_rescuing_network`
to add/remove rescuing network to `network` interface.
These methods are not added to `flat` network interface. If one
were to use same network for provisioning and rescuing, the removal
of rescuing network during rescue operation would remove the ports
related to the tenant network leading to a rescued node without any
network connectivity. The configure_tenant_networks() and
unconfigure_tenant_networks() methods are `pass` for `flat` network
interface which prevents re-configuration of tenant network if it
were to be removed.

Change-Id: I8f4123bfe7d293e8ff6f3bfc2f25445a39c94c73
Related-bug: #1526449

commit_message:
Add rescue related methods to network interface

Adds methods `add_rescuing_network` and `remove_rescuing_network`
to add/remove rescuing network to `network` interface.
These methods are not added to `flat` network interface.
The 'flat' network uses same network for tenant and provisioning.
It makes sense to use the same for rescuing as well; as opposed
to a separate network like we have for cleaning.

Change-Id: I8f4123bfe7d293e8ff6f3bfc2f25445a39c94c73
Related-bug: #1526449
Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>
Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jesse J. Cook <jesse.j.cook@member.fsf.org>
Co-Authored-By: Aparna <aparnavtce@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>
